description: F-LNG1 Zipf law at n=415 (S338) — 12th measurement, stall detection + projection update
hypothesis: Lesson citations follow power law with α ≈ 1.0 (Zipf), confirming ISO-8 isomorphism
interpretation: Lesson citation distribution is approximately Zipfian (α=0.746, R²=0.833). ISO-8 isomorphism PARTIALLY confirmed. α deviates from 1.0 — flatter (more even distribution) than canonical Zipf. Instantaneous rate shows near-stall (-0.00014/L vs prior -0.00231/L), but 3-point moving average (-0.00158/L) indicates decline continues with deceleration.
stall_note: Instantaneous rate -0.00014/L vs 3-point avg -0.00158/L. This mirrors the S327 stall (rate +0.000038/L) which was followed by resumed decline. Stall is real at point level but 3-point trend still declining.

projection_n450.note: Power-law model (R²=0.977) is better fit than linear (overpredicts decline). Projection revised UP from S335 estimate of 0.634 due to deceleration.

status_note: Decline continues but decelerating. α=0.7456 still above 0.70 intervention threshold. Instantaneous stall at n=415 parallels S327 stall at n=373 — both followed by resumed decline. No intervention needed yet.
methodology_note: Citation cache refreshed via compact.py before measurement. Prior S338 concurrent-session artifact was stale-cache (20 lessons falsely zero-cited, alpha=0.812 spurious). This measurement is the corrected ground truth.

cache_quality.root_cause: compact.py had not run since S335; 20 file SHA mismatches caused zero-citation false negatives
